name: Rhus venenata
Relationship: Antidote: CLEMATIS. The California Poison-oak (Rhus diversiloba) is identical with it. It antidotes RADIUM and follows it well. Compare: ANACARD.

Head: Heavy, frontal headache; worse, walking or stooping
Face swollen
Vesicular inflammation of ears
Nose red and shiny
Eyes nearly closed with great swelling
Mind: Great melancholy; no desire to live, gloomy
Abdomen: Profuse, watery, white stools in morning, four AM, with colicky pains; expelled with force
Pain in hypogastrium before every stool
Skin: Erythema nodosum, with nightly itching and pains in long bones
Extremities: Paralytic drawing in right arm, especially wrist, and extending to fingers

details: The skin symptoms of this species of Rhus are most severe.
